intro: Alloplectus fraternus, commonly known as the common false nettle, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a serrated margin, while the flowers are small and clustered in umbels. Alloplectus fraternus is not known to have stinging hairs, distinguishing it from other members of its family.
